main event: A housewife in Blytheville, Arkansas reported seeing several unidentified lights in the sky on March 29, 1967.
interesting points: The observer described the first sighting as a long white light, the second sighting as blue to white to pink, and the third sighting as yellow.
The second sighting involved two lights, while the first and third sightings involved single lights.
The lights were observed at different angles above the horizon, ranging from 40-45 degrees for the first two sightings to 50 degrees for the third sighting.
The observer stated the lights moved rapidly to the west and disappeared.
The sightings lasted between 5-25 minutes each.
